title: Mum’s shock as she takes her eyes off toddler for three minutes – and he shaves his own head
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments A MUM who left her three-year-old son alone for just three minutes discovered the tot had SHAVED a large patch of his hair off – and then threw a tantrum when he wasn’t allowed to finish the job. 
Carolyn Walsh, 39, found that Oakley had managed to get to his dad’s electric razor and shave off a large patch at the front of his hair while she went to the toilet. Mercury Press Oakley Walsh got hold of his dad’s electric razor and gave himself a haircut Mercury Press 6 He then threw a tantrum when his mum wouldn’t let him finish it 
The administrator claims that the haircut-loving tot then had the cheek to have a tantrum when she wouldn’t let him finish his haircut. 
The mum-of-three was forced to tell the three-year-old how “handsome” he looked in order to calm him down but has been left red-faced trying to explain the disaster hairstyle to family friends. 
Carolyn, from Swansea but now living in Cardiff with husband Andrew Walsh, 42, said: “I went to the toilet and I could hear a noise coming from the bedroom. I wasn’t sure what was happening. Mercury Press The three-year-old grabbed the razor while mum Carolyn went to the toilet Mercury Press He later agreed it wasn’t a good idea to cut his own hair 
“I thought he might have been playing with my electric toothbrush because he always takes it. 
“I was quite shocked at first to see him with a razor when I came out. I screamed but then there was a lot of laughter afterwards. 
“It’s so typical of him. I can’t even leave him alone for a second. He has done some peculiar things before. 
“He tried to go into a tantrum because we wouldn’t let him finish his haircut. We took the razor off him but he wanted it back so he started to get upset. “I told him that he was still handsome because his brothers always have long hair so he got a bit teary. 
“He agreed that it wasn’t a good idea to cut his own hair.” 
After the haircut disaster Carolyn has been using gel to cover up the patch as the hair is still too short to be fixed with a new cut. 
Carolyn said: “We’ve put a hat on him now because he gets a funny look. It’s hard to explain it to people. “Everyone has just been laughing at him. His brothers found it really funny. Mercury Press Carolyn is waiting to see what his first school picture turned out like as his teacher had to do his hair Mercury Press 6 But she was relieved that at least Oakley hadn’t made the attempt before her recent wedding to dad Andrew 
“It was his first school photo recently. The teacher did his hair so I won’t know how well it turned out until we get the picture back. 
“Me and my partner, have just got married. I’m so glad he didn’t do it before the wedding.” 
The shaver was originally placed in Andrew’s product box but it has now been moved to a cupboard which is out of the tot’s reach.
